item.title: Report X-2024110902
item.description:
Report X-2024110902

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-16
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Outer box labeled with NFPS/HMIS label. SDS was inside along with 4 X 1 gallon plastic bottles; each bottle was inside of a plastic bag. Unknown how the plastic bottle leaked, possibly punctured. Plastic Bottles are labeled as PERFECT SCORE HIGH PERFORMANCE HP-5503 CUTTING FLUID. All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No

item.title: Report I-2024100137
item.description:
Report I-2024100137

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: ENCINAL
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: NATIONAL FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While making a delivery, one damaged super sack was discovered. The load was refused by the consignee. CG Environmental was dispatched to inspect the trailer and perfotm the cleanup. CG Environmental inspected the trailer and discovered one damaged super sack. CG recovered approximately 1/4 pound of product and placed into a drum for disposal. The damaged bag was taped to prevent any additional product from leaking from the bag.

item.title: Report E-2024110431
item.description:
Report E-2024110431

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: HUMBLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 23, 2024, at 1400 ET, Roadrunner Transportation contacted ERTS regarding the release of 5 gallons of Xylene (UN1370, 3, II) from one 5-gallon plastic drum. The release was reportedly due to a load shift and was contained to the trailer floor. A contractor was dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (3) 55-gallon plastic drums and (3) 55-gallon metal drums. All waste drums were staged onsite pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110351
item.description:
Report E-2024110351

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 11, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Dichloromethane was punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the site. E3 personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Dichloromethane-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and one (1) broken-down impacted pallet were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) 55-gallon drum of Dichloromethane was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon over-pack drum.

item.title: Report I-2024110043
item.description:
Report I-2024110043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-20T12:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the flight the AFT Iav smoke detector went off. The FA's knocked on the door and the passenger in the Iav did not want to open the door at first immediately. She open the door and claimed her laptop(which was with her in the Iav) had started smoking. The Laptop was placed in TCB as a precaution, the passenger did not want to relinquish her laptop at first. FA's did not witness any smoke coming from the laptop; it is suspected the passenger may have been vaping in the Iav in actuality and that, that is how the smoke detector was activated. Upon landing, the passenger did not want to deplane without her laptop. The Passenger claimed United was stealing it from her. Police had to be called.

item.title: Report X-2024110612
